analysis.functional_summary: The JCL script is designed to compile and link-edit a BMS map named BNK1ACC. It utilizes a procedure called MAPGEN and specifies a member BNK1ACC with a relocation mode of ANY. The output is directed to a specified output class.

return_values: Success or failure of the compile and link-edit process

data_flow: Step 1: Include default settings from DEFAULT member
Step 2: Execute MAPGEN procedure with specified parameters
Step 3: Output the compiled and link-edited map to the specified output class
state_changes: Creation or update of compiled BMS map
Potential updates to system job logs
side_effects: File I/O operations for reading JCLLIB and writing output
Execution of system-level compile and link-edit commands
interface_points: JCLLIB ORDER directive for library access
INCLUDE MEMBER directive for default settings
performance_characteristics: Dependent on system compile and link-edit performance
Resource usage primarily during execution of MAPGEN procedure
error_handling: Standard JCL error handling through job return codes
Potential logging of errors in system job logs
modernization_notes: Consider refactoring JCL to use more modern build tools
analysis.analysis_notes: The JCL script is straightforward with minimal complexity, primarily serving as a wrapper for executing a compile and link-edit process using predefined procedures and settings.
